name: CommanDo
body:
# User Guide * [About](#about) * [Quick Start](#quick-start) * [Commands](#commands) * [FAQ](#faq) * [Command Cheatsheet](#command-cheatsheet) ___ ## About _CommanDo_ is a task scheduler that helps you to manage the flood of things you need to do (to-do items). This application is a primarily text-based – almost all input will be through commands, using the text box at the bottom. In this guide, we will be splitting the to-do items into 2 groups: events and tasks, which are identified by the number of date time fields they require. ___ ## Quick Start 1. Ensure you have Java version 1.8.0_60 or later installed in your Computer (earlier version of Java 8 will not work). 2. Download the latest commando.jar from the [releases](../../../releases) tab. 3. Copy the file to the folder you want to use as the home folder for _CommanDo_. 4. Double-click the file to start the app. The GUI should appear in a few seconds.

5. Type the command in the command box and press Enter to execute it.
e.g. typing help and pressing Enter will open the help window. 6. Some example commands you can try: * add participate in 'Eat and Become Fat' competition from 5 Sep 12:30 to 17:30
adds an event with title "participate in 'Eat and Become Fat' competition" with start date & time of 5th September 12:30 and end date & time of 5th Septemeber 17:30 * delete 3
deletes the to-do item visually numbered with a "3" * exit
exits the app 7. Refer to the [Commands](#commands) section below for details of each command.
___ ## Commands ### Viewing Help: help * Format: help [] > **Command Format** > * <> denotes fields to fill in > * [] denotes optional > * ... denotes 0 or more The command help hows a complete list of commands and examples of how to use them properly. If one command help [] is given, or if the fields in your input are incorrect, examples of how to use that command will be shown. ### Adding To-Do Items: add For starters, the first thing you would do is to add a to-do item. Your input must contain the necessary keywords in the given order. In this case, the add keyword must be at the start of your input. To-do items must contain at minimum, a description of what it is. They may contain additional information, like tags, or a time frame. In _CommanDo_, to-do items are split based on the number of date-time fields they contain, into Events and Tasks. Quick Summary Events | Tasks :---: | :----: Contains a START datetime and an END datetime | Contains an END datetime #### Events: Events are things that are active / happening within a time frame. In _CommanDo_, they are to-do items with a from keyword and a to keyword. In particular, the from keyword must come before the to keyword. * Format: **add** <description> **from** <start_datetime> **to** <end_datetime> [#<tag>...]

More examples: Input >> add meeting with boss from 5 Sep 12:30 to 17:30 #important >> add meeting with Dr Tan from 30 Sep 9:00 to 10:00 #work #important >> add wild party in hostel room from 31 Dec 2016 to 1 Jan 2017 #yolo Date & time formats are described in more detail [below](#supported-datetime-formats). #### Tasks: Tasks are to-do items that may be done in your own time, or have a deadline. In _CommanDo_, they are to-do items that may have a due field. A task can be something you need to do by a certain date or time, or just something you can do at your own time. * Format: add [by ] [#...]

More examples: Input >> add do Homework 10 by 23 Sep >> add release V0.5 by 7 Nov 2359 >> add finish FYP by tomorrow 2359 >> add shop for groceries: banana, pineapple, watermelon #housework >> add watch Lord of the Rings ### Editing To-Do Items: edit This command edits existing to-do items by accessing their index, and providing the fields to replace. At least one of the optional parameters should be included, if not the command does nothing. If there are tags in your input, they will replace the tags stored for the target to-do item. #### Events: Edits the details of an event, listed on screen with a number of . At least one of the optional parameters shown below must be provided to make a meaningful edit. * Format: edit [description] [from ] [to ] [#...]

More examples: >> add meeting with boss from today 1300 to today 1500 >> edit 1 from today 1400 to today 1600 >> edit 2 #projectABC #### Tasks: Edits the details of a task, listed on screen with a number of . At least one of the optional parameters below must be provided to make a meaningful edit. You can edit or add a due date-time to a task. You can also remove the due date-time from a task by entering nothing after the by keyword. * Format: edit [description] [by ] [#...]

More examples: - |Sequence of sample input | Description --|:-------------------------------| :-------- 1|`>> add plan shopping trip #lunch` | Adding a task 2|`>> edit 2 shopping trip to IKEA`| Changing the details 3|`>> edit 2 by 6 feb` | Adding a due date-time 4|`>> edit 2 by` | Removing the due date-time 5|`>> add watch Inception` | Adding a task 6|`>> edit 3 watch Gravity` | Changing the details 7|`>> edit 3 #family` | Adding tags ### Deleting To-Do Items: delete Deletes an event, deadline or floating task, listed on screen with a number of INDEX. * Format: delete

### Clearing all To-Do Items: clear Clears all to-do items. Use with caution. * Format: clear

### Finding To-Do Items: find Searches for and only lists all to-do items which have descriptions or tags containing *all* of the given keywords. * Format: find ...

> **How the search works:** > * If 0 keywords are provided, all to-do items will be shown. > * Case insensitive. – Chicken Egg will match chicken egg > * Ordering of the keywords does not matter. – Chicken Egg will match Egg Chicken > * Parts of words will be matched. – chickens will match chicken, chicken will not match chickens > * All keywords must be present. – find chicken egg will match chicken lay egg but not bird lay egg ### Setting Save Location: set Changes the location where the to-do list is saved on the file system to . * Format: set storage A file path can be absolute (C:/home/sally/statusReport) or relative to the .jar file (joe/foo/bar). This applies to the next two commands which too, deals with the file location. ### Exporting: export Exports the current to-do list as a save data file at . * Format: export ### Importing: import Imports a valid save data file at and overrides the current to-do list with the imported to-do list. * Format: import ### Undoing: undo Undos the last add, edit, delete, clear, import or set storage command. * Format: undo ### Exiting the Application : exit Closes the application. * Format: exit ___ ## FAQ ### Saving data Your to-do list is automatically saved to your file system after any command that changes the data. There is no need to save manually. ### Sharing data across devices Use the export command to generate a save data file, transfer the file to a 2nd device, and use the import command on the 2nd device to import your to-do list from that save file. Alternatively, you can use a cloud-syncing service (e.g. [Dropbox](dropbox.com)) and the set storage command to sync the to-do list automatically by setting to the same storage file on both devices. ### Supported date-time formats *CommanDo* supports a wide variety of date and time formats. A valid date-time is defined as: 1. A valid date. 2. A valid date followed by a valid time. where examples of valid dates include: | Standard Date Notation | With words | Presets | |:-------------------------- |:------------------- |:------------------------------------------------ | | 10/02/2016 *(DD/MM/YYYY)*| 10 Feburary 2016 | today | | 10/02/16 *(DD/MM/YY)* | 10 Feb 2016 | tomorrow | | 10/02 *(DD/MM)* | 10 Feb | next Wednesday | | | 10th Feb | days after *(where is bigger than 0)*| | | Feb 10 | | and examples of valid time include: | Standard Time Notation | Omitted Colons | Presets | |:--------- |:------ |:-------------------------------- | | 19:00 *(hh:mm)* | 2359 | morning *(0900h by default)* | | 9am *(hh)pm/am* | 0911h| afternoon *(1200h by default)* | | 11:59pm *(hh:mm)pm/am* | | evening *(1900h by default)* | ___ ## Command Cheatsheet Command | Format -------------------| :-------- Help | help [] Add Event | add from to [#...] Add Task | add [by ] [#...] Edit Event | edit [description] [from ] [to ] [#...] Edit Task | edit [description] [by ] [#...] Delete To-Do Item | delete Clear | clear Find | find ... Set Save Location | set storage Export | export Import | Import Undo | undo Exit | exit
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
